image.alt: Patients and team smiling outside Amley McEntire Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Amley McEntire Orthodontics is a family-focused, board-certified orthodontic practice serving Tampa Bay from convenient offices in St. Petersburg and South Tampa. With a tradition of clinical excellence and modern technology, we create confident, healthy smiles for kids, teens, and adults.

Our team builds personalized treatment plans using digital imaging and proven techniques. We offer clear communication, flexible scheduling, and virtual consultations so care fits your family's busy life.

items.title: Board-Certified Team

image.alt: Orthodontic team reviewing patient records

items.text: Our specialists are board certified and pursue ongoing training to deliver precise, evidence-based orthodontic care.

items.title: Family-Focused Care

image.alt: Welcoming orthodontic reception area

items.text: We take time to know each patient and design treatment plans that fit your goals and lifestyle.

items.title: Modern Technology

image.alt: Digital orthodontic imaging and 3D planning

items.text: We use digital scans, 3D planning, and clear aligner systems to make treatment predictable and efficient.

items.title: Convenient Locations

image.alt: Two Amley McEntire Orthodontics office locations

items.text: Two offices in St. Petersburg and South Tampa, plus virtual consultations and flexible scheduling.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Clayton McEntire, DMD, MSD leads our practice with a focus on precise, compassionate care and individualized treatment plans for patients of all ages. He trained in orthodontics after completing dental and graduate studies and uses evidence-based techniques to achieve predictable results.

image.alt: Dr. Clayton McEntire, orthodontist at Amley McEntire Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Rick Escobar, DMD, MSD is an ABO Board Certified orthodontist who returns to Tampa Bay to provide expert, patient-centered care. He completed dental school and advanced orthodontic training, and he focuses on clear communication and comfortable treatment experiences for families.

image.alt: Dr. Rick Escobar, orthodontist at Amley McEntire Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We offer Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, braces, early orthodontic screenings, and optional finishing services like professional whitening to help you reach your smile goals.

image.alt: Patient holding Invisalign clear aligners
Smiling patient with traditional braces
Child smiling at reception for an early orthodontic visit
Orthodontic finishing services and whitening

testimonials.author: Roberto R
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. McEntire and his team are simply the best! From the moment you walk in, you're greeted with warmth and professionalism. They answer every question with care, and the results are absolutely amazing. I couldn’t be happier — highly recommend!”

testimonials.author: Amy D
testimonials.testimonial: “Two of my sons have had braces with Dr. McEntire. One of them also had expanders prior to braces. They are fantastic! All of the staff are professional and kind. They run on time and the office is very comfortable. Highly recommended!”

testimonials.author: Natalie R
testimonials.testimonial: “Carlynn was the biggest help in helping me find care in navigation with my insurance.”

og_meta.title: Home - Amley McEntire Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Family-focused, board-certified orthodontic care in Tampa Bay offering Invisalign, braces, early treatment, and virtual consultations.

image.alt: The Amley McEntire Orthodontics team smiling together in a bright clinic lobby

About.title: Serve and Smile: The Amley McEntire Orthodontics Mission

paragraphs.text: You deserve a local orthodontist with both community roots and clinical expertise. With decades of trusted care behind us, we blend time‑honored experience and modern orthodontic techniques to help each patient feel informed and comfortable.

Our care is community‑focused and patient‑first. We take time to listen, explain options clearly, and tailor treatment plans so they fit each patient’s life, whether that means braces, early orthodontics, or aligner therapy.

We offer a full range of treatments, including Damon self‑ligating braces and Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, for teens and adults. Our team uses gentle techniques and the latest digital tools to make visits efficient and predictable.

Beyond great clinical results, we aim to make orthodontics accessible with flexible scheduling, transparent financing, and a welcoming office where families feel cared for from the first visit onward.

image.alt: Dr. Clayton McEntire smiling in clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Clayton McEntire is an orthodontist who brings modern, family‑centered care to the Tampa Bay area. He focuses on individualized treatment plans that combine evidence‑based techniques with a patient‑forward approach, ensuring families feel respected and confident throughout care.

image.alt: Dr. Clayton McEntire in a treatment room

paragraphs.text: Dr. McEntire studied biomedical science at Auburn University, earned his dental degree at the University of Alabama at Birmingham, and completed his orthodontic training at Virginia Commonwealth University. He graduated with academic honors and pursued optional board certification to deepen his clinical expertise.

image.alt: Dr. McEntire reviewing treatment plans

paragraphs.text: A native of Alabama, Dr. McEntire enjoys raising his family in the Tampa Bay area with his wife Abby and their five children. He is active in his church and local community and takes pride in mentoring the next generation of clinicians while delivering compassionate care to families near home.

image.alt: Dr. McEntire with a patient
Dr. Rick Escobar reviewing a 3D dental model

paragraphs.text: Dr. Rick Escobar is a hometown orthodontist committed to evidence‑based, compassionate care. Board certified and experienced in comprehensive orthodontics, he treats children, teens, and adults with an emphasis on clear communication and predictable results.

image.alt: Dr. Rick Escobar consulting with a patient

paragraphs.text: Dr. Escobar earned undergraduate degrees in chemistry and biology at Southern Methodist University, completed dental training at Nova Southeastern University, and attained his orthodontic certificate and Master of Science in Dentistry from the University of Colorado. He is ABO board certified and holds multiple professional honors.

image.alt: Dr. Escobar with clinical equipment

paragraphs.text: A Tampa native, Dr. Escobar values giving back to his hometown through community outreach and patient education. Outside the office he enjoys local activities and supporting youth programs, bringing a community‑minded perspective to clinical care.

image.alt: Dr. Escobar interacting with the team

og_meta.title: About Us | Amley McEntire Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Meet our doctors and team, and learn how we support families across Tampa Bay with modern, community‑focused orthodontic care.

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at the orthodontic front desk

paragraphs.heading: A Warm Welcome
paragraphs.text: Our friendly team is here to ensure your experience is comfortable and pleasant. We look forward to meeting you and helping you begin the journey to a healthier smile.

paragraphs.heading: Comprehensive Check-up
paragraphs.text: During your free initial consultation we'll take X-rays and photos so the doctor can fully assess your teeth and bite. The doctor will review these images with you and explain any findings.

paragraphs.heading: Your Options and Solutions
paragraphs.text: We’ll guide you through treatment options, costs, payment choices, and scheduling. Our team will answer your questions so you can make an informed decision that fits your needs.

paragraphs.heading: Gentle Treatment and Care
paragraphs.text: We focus on delivering gentle, effective care tailored to each patient. After treatment begins, we continue to support you with advice and follow-up to keep your smile on track.

image.alt: Parent and child at orthodontic reception

paragraphs.text: We provide transparent cost estimates and will work with you to make care accessible. To make payments easy, we accept credit card, in-office financing, cash, and check.

We want you to get the most from any coverage and will help at every step. We are contracted with MetLife, accept PPO policies with out-of-network benefits, and can assist with claim filing. For additional questions, contact us: https://www.amley-mcentire.com/contact-us/
Access your forms for a streamlined visit. Completing these before your appointment helps us provide safe, personalized care right away.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online
Family enjoying time together after orthodontic care

og_meta.title: Get Started | Amley McEntire Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey with Amley McEntire Orthodontics. Learn what to expect, access new patient forms, review payment and insurance options, and booka

image.alt: Happy smiling father and daughter entering Amley McEntire ortho office

paragraphs.text: We provide modern orthodontic solutions including Damon™ self-ligating metal braces, designed to move teeth efficiently and comfortably. Many patients enjoy fewer adjustments and a more comfortable experience compared with traditional systems.

image.alt: Patient smiling with custom metal braces

paragraphs.text: For patients who want a less noticeable option, Symetri™ clear braces offer a low-profile, aesthetic solution without sacrificing strength or effectiveness.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking a selfie

paragraphs.text: Clear traditional braces blend discreet esthetics with predictable tooth movement, making them a popular choice for patients seeking a subtle look with reliable results.

image.alt: Smiling woman with a clear orthodontic appliance

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners are a discreet, removable alternative to braces. They’re comfortable to wear and allow you to eat, brush, and floss normally while gradually straightening teeth.
We use 3D scanning and treatment planning to create custom trays and a clear plan from day one, so you know what to expect as your smile changes.

image.alt: Orthodontic team celebrating with a happy patient

paragraphs.text: We recommend early evaluations around age seven to identify developing issues. Early intervention can guide jaw growth, create space for erupting teeth, and often reduce the need for more extensive treatment later.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: To protect your new smile, we offer a range of retainers tailored to your needs: classic Hawley retainers, clear Essix retainers, and Vivera® retainers by Invisalign. We’ll help you choose the best option for long-term stability.

image.alt: Young woman holding an orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: For patients who feel their smile is overly ‘gummy,’ laser gingivectomy is a minimally invasive option that reshapes the gumline to reveal more tooth and improve smile balance.

image.alt: Patient smiling after orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: After orthodontic care, professional teeth whitening can enhance your results and boost confidence. We offer office-grade options designed to deliver noticeable, long-lasting brightness.

image.alt: Woman holding smartphone and smiling
Family enjoying time together after orthodontic care

image.alt: Smiling father and daughter entering Amley McEntire Orthodontics reception area, bright modern office with welcoming staff

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about orthodontic care, treatment options, scheduling, and payment plans at Amley McEntire Orthodontics.

Early Start Orthodontics focuses on identifying growth and bite concerns while the jaw is still developing. An early evaluation lets us monitor development and create a plan that may reduce the need for more complex treatment later. Watch our early start overview video for details: https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-2.mp4

image.alt: FAQ poster image for early start orthodontics video, colorful poster with clinic branding

accordion.header: Am I too old for braces or Invisalign<sup>®</sup>?

paragraphs.text: Orthodontic treatment can be effective at any age. Many adults choose braces or Invisalign<sup>®</sup> to improve function and confidence. Adults currently make up about 20 to 25 percent of orthodontic patients, and we tailor treatment to adult goals and schedules. Learn more and see if you are a candidate: https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-2.mp4

image.alt: Adult patient consulting with orthodontic team in modern office, friendly conversation about treatment options

accordion.header: What kinds of braces do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We provide traditional metal braces, clear ceramic options, and Damon braces. Damon braces combine passive self-ligating brackets with shape-memory wires and a treatment approach designed to move teeth efficiently. This system may reduce treatment time, decrease the number of office visits, and improve comfort for many patients.

image.alt: Close-up of orthodontic braces and bracket system, illustrative image showing modern bracket design

accordion.header: How long does treatment usually take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment length depends on the complexity of the case, growth rate, and patient cooperation. Most patients complete treatment within 12 to 24 months. We’ll give you a personalized timeline during your initial consultation.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation with dentist explaining treatment timeline using digital images

accordion.header: What are some signs that braces may be needed?

paragraphs.text: Look for upper front teeth that protrude over lower teeth, a deep bite, underbite, open bite, crowded or overlapping teeth, misaligned midlines, prolonged thumb-sucking, difficulty chewing, uneven tooth wear, jaw shifting when biting, or gaps between teeth. If you notice any of these signs, schedule an evaluation.

image.alt: Child during orthodontic exam showing signs that may indicate need for braces

paragraphs.text: Placing braces is painless, though you may feel soreness for one to four days after placement and some tenderness after adjustments. Most patients find any discomfort eases quickly and becomes manageable as the mouth adjusts.

image.alt: Patient smiling after orthodontic appointment showing comfortable recovery from braces adjustments

accordion.header: Will braces interfere with playing sports?

paragraphs.text: Braces do not prevent you from playing sports. We recommend wearing a properly fitted mouth guard to protect your teeth and appliances. Mouth guards are affordable, comfortable, and available in a variety of styles.

image.alt: Young athlete wearing protective mouth guard while playing sports, showing safe participation with braces

accordion.header: What if a bracket becomes loose?

paragraphs.text: A loose bracket means the bond has been broken. Call our office to schedule an appointment and, if possible, save the bracket and bring it with you. We will reattach it and keep your treatment on track.

image.alt: Loose orthodontic bracket being inspected by orthodontic team, close-up of bracket and tooth

accordion.header: What if the archwire is broken, or a hook or ligature is lost?

paragraphs.text: Broken wires, lost hooks, or missing ligatures can affect tooth movement and should be repaired promptly. Call our office at 727-381-1062 to schedule a repair appointment so your treatment stays on track.

image.alt: Orthodontic appliance repair demonstration, close-up of archwire adjustment

accordion.header: What are the benefits of orthodontics?

paragraphs.text: Benefits of orthodontics include a more attractive smile, reduced self-consciousness during key developmental years, improved tooth function, a potential boost in self-confidence, easier cleaning, better distribution of biting forces, long-term dental and gum health, correct alignment of permanent teeth, a lower risk of injury to prominent front teeth, and enhancement of other dental treatments.

image.alt: Before and after conceptual image illustrating benefits of orthodontic treatment and improved smile

accordion.header: Would an adult patient benefit from orthodontics?

paragraphs.text: Yes. Orthodontic treatment can improve dental health and appearance at any age. Many adults choose treatment to address long-standing bite issues, prepare for restorative work, or simply to gain a straighter smile.

image.alt: Adult patient smiling after orthodontic treatment, confident and happy

accordion.header: At what age should my child see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends an orthodontic evaluation by age 7. Early detection allows us to guide jaw growth and tooth eruption and can sometimes prevent more complex treatment later.

image.alt: Young child receiving an orthodontic evaluation in a bright, child-friendly treatment room

paragraphs.text: When should my child get braces? Kids typically begin after most adult teeth come in, usually between ages 8 and 14, though early evaluation is important. How long will treatment last? Average treatment for children ranges from 18 months to 2 years. Are braces really necessary? In many cases braces correct alignment problems that, if untreated, can lead to decay or jaw issues. Are braces uncomfortable for kids? Some soreness is normal after placement or adjustments but it fades quickly. How much do braces cost for kids? Costs vary by case; schedule a consultation at our Saint Petersburg, FL office for an accurate estimate.

image.alt: Smiling child at orthodontic appointment, reassuring environment for kids receiving braces

paragraphs.text: Step 1: Initial consultation where we take 3D images, discuss goals, and show a smile preview. Step 2: Fitting of the custom aligners and instructions for wear. Step 3: Progress through sets of aligners, with a retainer at the end to maintain results. Invisalign<sup>®</sup> for teens is comfortable, discreet, and removable for eating and special events. Learn more and book a free consultation: https://www.amley-mcentire.com/schedule-appointment/ Additional videos: Will Getting Braces or Invisalign Hurt? https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-1.mp4 and Am I a Candidate? https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-2.mp4

image.alt: Teen smiling during an Invisalign consultation at Amley McEntire Orthodontics, comfortable and discreet aligners

paragraphs.text: Watch our FAQ videos to hear answers from the clinical team: FAQ-1.mp4 https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-1.mp4, FAQ-2.mp4 https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-2.mp4, FAQ-3.mp4 https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-3.mp4, FAQ-4.mp4 https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-4.mp4, and FAQ-5.mp4 https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/FAQ-5.mp4. For our Braces for Kiddos poster and video, see https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/faq-3-poster.jpg and https://www.amley-mcentire.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/frequently-asked-questions-three.mp4

image.alt: Poster linking to Braces for Kiddos video, visual resource for families

paragraphs.text: If you are a dentist in Tampa or Saint Petersburg, FL and would like to refer a patient, we will collaborate on treatment and continuity of care. For referring dentist details and to learn how we coordinate care, visit https://www.amley-mcentire.com/referring-dentists/

image.alt: Professional collaboration between orthodontist and referring dentist, team discussing patient care
Family enjoying time together after orthodontic care
